title: Exam: Change Management & Innovation
description: Assessment of change management vocabulary, innovation types, and modal verbs for deduction.

items.explanation: We use 'must have' when we are almost certain about a past event based on evidence.
items.prompt: Which modal expresses a high degree of certainty that a past event occurred?

items.explanation: To streamline is to simplify a process.
items.prompt: We need to ________ our communication channels to ensure everyone receives updates simultaneously.

items.explanation: A bottleneck is a part of a process that slows everything else down.
items.prompt: Which term describes a point of congestion in a system that creates delays?

items.explanation: Modal for negative deduction.
items.prompt: The team ________ (can't / receive) the email yesterday, otherwise they would have replied by now.

items.explanation: Incremental innovation refers to small, continuous improvements.
items.prompt: What does 'incremental innovation' refer to?

items.explanation: Buy-in is the agreement and support for a proposed change.
items.prompt: The CEO is looking for ________ from the department heads before implementing the new policy.

items.explanation: UAT is the final phase of testing.
items.prompt: Before the software goes live, we must complete the ________ phase with our end-users.

items.explanation: Creating urgency is the first step in Kotter's 8-Step Model.
items.prompt: According to Kotter, what is the very first step in a successful change process?

items.explanation: 'Should have' expresses regret or a missed opportunity.
items.prompt: We ________ (prepare) for the server migration more thoroughly; the downtime was unacceptable.

items.explanation: Legacy systems are outdated.
items.prompt: The company's reliance on ________ systems is preventing us from being truly agile.

items.explanation: A pivot is a strategic change in direction.
items.prompt: When the initial marketing strategy failed, the startup decided to ________ and focus on B2B clients instead.

items.explanation: Disruptive innovation completely changes an industry.
items.prompt: Digital photography was a ________ innovation that eventually replaced the film industry.

items.explanation: Needn't have is for unnecessary past actions.
items.prompt: We ________ (hire) the external consultant because our in-house team already had the solution.

options: To make it permanent in the corporate culture.
items.explanation: Anchoring ensures the change stays part of the culture.
items.prompt: What is the goal of 'anchoring' a change in Kotter's model?

items.explanation: 'Might have' expresses low certainty/possibility.
items.prompt: The files are missing. They ________ (be / delete) by accident during the system update.

items.explanation: Migration is moving data.
items.prompt: The data ________ to the new cloud server will take approximately six hours.

items.explanation: Resistance is the reaction against change.
items.prompt: Which of these is a COMMON CHALLENGE when implementing new administrative processes?

items.explanation: Must have + past participle.
items.prompt: The project was a huge success! The team ________ (work) very hard on the implementation.

items.explanation: Short-term wins help maintain motivation.
items.prompt: To maintain momentum during a long project, it is essential to celebrate ________.

items.explanation: Agile methodologies focus on speed and adaptability.
items.prompt: An ________ approach involves breaking down tasks into short phases with frequent reassessment.
